verses.verse: (2 Kings 17.4; Isa 30.6) Ephraim herds the wind and pursues the east wind all day long; they multiply falsehood and violence; they make a treaty with Assyria, and oil is carried to Egypt.
(The Long History of Rebellion) (Hos 4.9; Mic 6.2) The LORD has an indictment against Judah and will punish Jacob according to his ways and repay him according to his deeds.
(Gen 25.26; 32.24, 28) In the womb he tried to supplant his brother, and in his manhood he strove with God.
(Gen 28.12-15; 32.26) He strove with the angel and prevailed; he wept and sought his favor; he met him at Bethel, and there he spoke with him. (Gk Syr: Heb us)
The LORD the God of hosts, the LORD is his name!
(Hos 6.8; Mic 6.8; 7.7) But as for you, return to your God; hold fast to love and justice, and wait continually for your God.
(Am 8.5; Mic 6.11) A trader in whose hands are false balances, he loves to oppress.
(Hos 4.8; 13.6; 14.1; Rev 3.17) Ephraim has said, “Ah, I am rich; I have gained wealth for myself; in all of my gain no offense has been found in me that would be sin.” (Meaning of Heb uncertain)
(Lev 23.42; Neh 8.17; Hos 11.1) I am the LORD your God from the land of Egypt; I will make you live in tents again, as in the days of the appointed festival.
(2 Kings 17.13; Jer 7.25; Ezek 17.2; 20.49) I spoke to the prophets; it was I who multiplied visions, and through the prophets I will bring destruction.

(Hos 4.15; 6.8; 9.15; 10.1, 2) In (Syr: Heb If) Gilead there is iniquity; they shall surely come to nothing. In Gilgal they sacrifice bulls, so their altars shall be like stone heaps on the furrows of the field.
(Gen 28.5) Jacob fled to the land of Aram; there Israel served for a wife, and for a wife he guarded sheep. (Heb lacks sheep)
(Ex 13.3) By a prophet the LORD brought Israel up from Egypt, and by a prophet he was guarded.
(Ezek 18.10-13; Dan 11.18; Mic 6.16) Ephraim has given bitter offense, so his Lord will bring his crimes down on him and pay him back for his insults.
